Missed the best lemon drink, lemoncello, soak zest of 12-14 lemons (avoid white pith) in 1 1/2 quarts ( 1 1/2 liters) of 120 proof grain alcohol for 30 days, then sift out zest. Dissolve 2 to 4 cups of sugar (tart to sweet) in to 2 times the amount water compared to the amount of alcohol. Let cool before combining two liquids. This gives a 40 proof lemon liquor that goes great in sparkling water or a real KICK sipped by itself. Enjoy 😉

Some Lemonade tips:

For the standard lemonade, don't mix the sugar and water in directly. Instead, make a simple syrup by dissolving it on the stove, then letting it cool before mixing with the juice. Works much better.


For the lemon peel soak, only take shallow cuts with your peeler. The zest (yellow part) has a lot of lemon flavor. The pith (white part) is what makes it bitter. Avoid any white on your zest.
